title: How to Make Lawn Clipping Tea

steps.headline: Fill a bucket with freshly cut grass.
Place the grass in a netting bag.
steps.description: The type used to go around onions or oranges is ideal.

steps.headline: Fill a large bucket or a drum with water.
Suspend the grass stuffed bag in the water.
Bubble water with aquarium air pump and air stone.
Use the liquid tonic.
steps.description: After the grass has finished steeping, you will be rewarded with a nutrient-rich grass "tea" that is perfect for feeding your plants.

text: Fill a bucket with freshly cut grass.  Place the grass in a netting bag. The type used to go around onions or oranges is ideal. Fill a large bucket or a drum with water.  Suspend the grass stuffed bag in the water.  Bubble water with aquarium air pump and air stone.  Leave for 2 - 3 days.  Use the liquid tonic. After the grass has finished steeping, you will be rewarded with a nutrient-rich grass "tea" that is perfect for feeding your plants.
